content:
I am working on the issue #19090 to improve users list admin page for mobile widths.
The issue suggests to hide the last active column, but we would need to do something else too.
rename-last-active.png

One thing is that instead of the two actions buttons, we can have something like three-dot menu which expands to give two options. Any other ideas?
The three-dot menu seems reasonable... I wouldn't spend a ton of time on this, since org settings on mobile web are not a highly visible area.

@Sahil Batra I'm not sure it's worth the implementation complexity of doing that sort of micro-optimization -- just removing "last active" makes it possible to read, if a bit annoying. And switching to a 3-dots menu for mobile only will only save a few pixels.

Realistically what someone is likely to do for more serious goals is just turn their phone sideways, which will work well.
What I think would be reasonable to consider is if we want to just move to a 3-dots menu instead of those icons in all cases -- that might be cleaner design overall.
The main downside is I guess the extra click to actually do things. But I've never been super happy with the visuals of those colors Actions icons.

I agree that that the icons look funky... But if we bury them under another click, we should think about the experience of bulk actions -- an extra click is a big pain point if you are trying to do something 20 times.
Yeah, I agree with that concern as well. Certainly I find the various Google admin products that do bury everything under a bonus click to be pretty annoying.
